biography.introduction: Anwar al-Mashayikh, the respected Maulana Khalifa Sahib Fazluddin (RA), known as Khalifa Sahib Arghandi, was one of Afghanistan's renowned scholars and great mystics.
biography.father: His father was named Muhammad Zarin, a virtuous and pious man. He studied reading and writing for about 6 years in his village school.
biography.education: He then completed the traditional religious sciences in various religious schools in Afghanistan. For the study of tafsir, he became a student of Sheikh al-Hadith Maulana Abdul Ghaffar Nangarhari, and studied under Sheikh al-Hadith Maulana Nasiruddin Gharghashtai (RA) at the Noor al-Madaris school in Ghazni.
biography.educationJourneyDesc: He completed his religious education in various madrasas across Afghanistan, studying under renowned scholars.
biography.spiritualJourneyDesc: His spiritual journey led him to become a great mystic and spiritual guide for many seekers of truth.
biography.firstMadrasaDesc: He established the first madrasa in Arghandi, Kabul, which became a center of Islamic learning.
biography.firstMadrasaTeaching: He began teaching hadith, tafsir, and Islamic sciences to students from various regions.
biography.migrationDesc: During the difficult times, he migrated and established Anwarul Uloom in Miranshah, Pakistan.
biography.migrationTeaching: He continued his teaching mission in Pakistan, serving the Muslim community there.
biography.migrationLegacy: His migration period was marked by continued dedication to Islamic education and spiritual guidance.
biography.deathDesc: He passed away leaving behind a legacy of knowledge and spiritual guidance.
biography.funeral: His funeral was attended by thousands of people from various regions.
biography.dream: Many people reported seeing him in their dreams after his passing, indicating his continued spiritual presence.
biography.brother1: His elder brother was also a scholar and teacher.
biography.brother2: His younger brother supported him in his educational mission.

biography.reestablishmentDesc: After the family's return from migration, the madrasa was re-established in Arghandi by Taj al-Mashayikh Khalifa Sahib Saduzi Gharighi and the Sheikh's sons, scholars, and students.
biography.reestablishmentPrayer: May Allah accept this blessed re-establishment and continue the legacy of Islamic education.
biography.subjectsDescription: The madrasa teaches various Islamic sciences including Quran, Hadith, Tafsir, Fiqh, Arabic language, and other traditional subjects.
biography.subjectsNote: All subjects are taught according to traditional Islamic methodology and authentic sources.
